meanings.definition: Swang (past tense of swing): moved back and forth or from side to side
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I swang on the swing at the park.
meanings.sent2: The pendulum swang gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The monkey swang from tree to tree with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions swang wildly between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The chandelier swang gracefully above the dining table.

meanings.definition: Swang (past participle of swing): having moved back and forth or from side to side
meanings.sent1: The swang door creaked as it moved in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The swang bridge was a popular spot for photos.
meanings.sent3: The swang curtain fluttered in the open window.
meanings.sent4: His swang arms reached out to catch the ball.
meanings.sent5: The swang branches of the tree provided shade on hot days.

meanings.definition: Swang (noun): a swinging motion or movement
meanings.sent1: The swang of the pendulum was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The playground was filled with the joyful swang of children.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's graceful swang captivated the audience.
meanings.sent4: The swang of the boat rocked us gently to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic swang of the hammock was soothing on a lazy afternoon.
